Topic.Title: Quest game in this year's IFComp

Posts.EditableText: There's a Quest game "Gathered In Darkness" by Dr. Froth in this year's IFComp. You can download it from [url=http://www.ifarchive.org/indexes/if-archiveXgamesXcompetition2007XquestXgatheredindarkness.html:2ru0o1d3]this page[/url:2ru0o1d3]. Alternatively, you might find it quicker (as I did) to just download the entire games package from a mirror: http://www.ifcomp.org/comp07/download.html The rule on discussing competition entries has been [url=http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.int-fiction/browse_thread/thread/8cea19154362a05d/1434bc1734b8454d#1434bc1734b8454d:2ru0o1d3]relaxed this year[/url:2ru0o1d3], so we're free to discuss the game here. And any of the other games of course - even though they're not written in Quest, I do really recommend you try them out, just to give you an idea for what other people are doing with text adventure games.
Posts.HTML:
There's a Quest game "Gathered In Darkness" by Dr. Froth in this year's IFComp.

You can download it from this page.

Alternatively, you might find it quicker (as I did) to just download the entire games package from a mirror: http://www.ifcomp.org/comp07/download.html

The rule on discussing competition entries has been relaxed this year, so we're free to discuss the game here. And any of the other games of course - even though they're not written in Quest, I do really recommend you try them out, just to give you an idea for what other people are doing with text adventure games.

Posts.EditableText: Just to clarify, everyone who isn't an IFComp entrant can discuss the games. Entrants who do that run the risk of their games being disqualified.
Posts.HTML: Just to clarify, everyone who isn't an IFComp entrant can discuss the games. Entrants who do that run the risk of their games being disqualified.

Posts.EditableText: Ah yes. We are deprived of davidw's rantings until the end of the competition
